text: <!channel>: on user profiles - do we always know 100% of emails and phone numbers?   twitter and insta are optional?
That's what I was assuming with the designs. (think i remember that from previous conversations)
if user does not have twit or insta - the table row does not display or does it still display the "twitter" heading with empty below it?
for my part - I'd like to include the empty/greyed field there as an indicator that they can add that data
what about for other user profiles you are viewing, not your own
right. i was thinking public hide for sure
agreed on that front
for user, just replace @nicekicksnunez with an em-dash?
also, if no social, let's hide the 2px rule as well
while we’re on the topic, are twitter and instagram the only social links users can add to their profile?
or are there others too?
thanks for clarifying
I think ideally users can add other links - VSCO comes to mind off the top. At this stage though, Im personally okay with leaving it as just those two if that helps with dev/design time
i think VSCO is going to be important
and we should probably assume that

I’m fine with adding vsco too or any others. I mostly want to confirm that we’re giving them a predefined set of accounts they’re allowed to link to, as opposed to letting them add any social links they want?

I agree. Perhaps we add that as a third static field. I suppose what I'm looking out towards is a system where someone can just N number of links. How we manage that interface-wise is still not defined
I'd like to get to the point where people just add them, but for the sake of simplicity - and someone speak up if Im off base here - I was thinking we'd stick with a static list
i’ll put in spots in data model for instagram, twitter, vsco, and facebook for now. we can expose any or all of them in the app.
perfect
